hanzi-su-wiki:
則

Значения

Правило, закон; придерживаться, следовать

Мнемоника

Следствие, норма, закон — за воровство денег 貝 следует казнь мечом 刂.

Варианты

则

heisig_chinese_memo: When you have both money and the power of the sword, you can make the rules.
heisig_constituent: rule, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, sword, sabre, saber
heisig_story: The character depicts a clam alongside a great and flashing saber. Think of digging for clams in an area where there are gaming rules governing how large a find has to be before you can keep it. So you take your trusty saber, which you have carefully notched like a yardstick, crack open a clam and then measure the poor little beastie to see if it is as long as the rules say it has to be.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: rule, follow, based on, model after
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: правило, следует, на основе, модели после
koohiiStory1: When you have both money and the power of the sword, you can make the rules.
koohiiStory2: If you´ve got CRABs on your SABER, then you didn´t follow the rules of safe sex!
jp_example_words:
原則(げんそく): principle, general rule
不規則(ふきそく): irregularity, unsteadiness, disorderly
法則(ほうそく): law, rule
規則(きそく): regulations
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A shellfish with a knife makes all the rules. It isn't supposed to be making rules, but it has a knife, so who's going to argue?
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture a shellfish wielding a knife and shouting out new rules to all of the nervous people standing around it.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The first rule the shellfish enacts is that all humans take off their socks (そく) and give them to him. Hmm... is this some kind of nasty shellfish? Who would want socks?
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Once everyone follows the rule, and the shellfish is on top of a pile of socks, he cackles, "It's easier to stab your toes with my knife now! Let's get to more rules!"
Ru_Meaning: rule, follow, based on, model after

Ru_trainchinese:
zé: (графема/сч.слово) норма; закон, правило; (книжн.) подражать; (для новостей, сочинений и т.д.) статья, раздел
zé: (союз) (указывает на последовательность) и потом...; (указывает на причину и следствие) (если...,) и тогда...; (указывает на противопоставление) же, а; (указывает на уступку) правда, ...-то
zé: (частица) следует за 一, 二 или 三 и используется для перечисления причин; используется как связка
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the shellfish (貝) with the sword (刂) makes the rules
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This shellfish rules the sea with a sword at his side.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The inscription from the " ding " to the " sword " means using a knife to engrave characters on the ding as a rule. The original meaning is the law. "Zuo Zhuan. The Sixth Year of Zhaogong": "Zheng people cast a penalty book", Du's note: "To cast a penalty book in a tripod is the common law of the country." " It is " still retains the original meaning of the word, but also as a function words under the guise of " the ." "Said Wen": "Then, wait for the paintings. From the knife to the shell. Shell, the ancient objects and goods. 𠟻, the ancient text. 𠞋, also the ancient text. 𠟭, the 籒wen from the tripod."

The " ding " on the bamboo slips of the Warring States period is often written as " bei ", which is the origin of the small seal. The " bei " in the word " ze " today is actually an error of the ancient word " ding ". The bamboo slips " ding " shape or simply "目" shape, add two horizontal lines below to simplify symbols.

Jin Wen said to obey the law, the teacher inquired: "If you don't show civil and martial arts, if you receive the order of heaven (order), you will also get the people." It means that the prominent Zhou Wenwang and Wu Wang will accept the destiny and make the Yin Shang survivors obey The law of the Zhou Dynasty. Also used as a conjunction, Zhongshan Wang Fanghu: "Respect and respect, then the wise will come." It also means to engrave and record, 𠫑Qiang bell: "Ming is in the inscription", which means that it is clearly engraved in the inscription.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were used as conjunctions, "Guodianjian. "Five Elements" Jane 6: "[Not] If you are safe, you will not take medicine (music), and if you do not take medicine (music) you will die (no) virtue (Germany)." "Guodian Jian. "Five Elements" Jian 29: "Harmony leads to music, and music leads to virtue (Germany)." "Guodian Jian. "Zun Deyi" Jane 33: "If you are unfaithful, you will not believe." "Shangbo Bamboo Book One. Jane 17 of "Bao Yi": "The people are cautious in words and in deeds." "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Congzheng A" Jane 7: "If you don't respect, you will die (nothing), the city (cheng)". "Shangbo Bamboo Book Seven. Jane 14: "Jing Sheng Lao Ze Ji". "Tsinghua Jane One. "Senior Night" Jane 11: "Mother (wu) has (already) great medicine (joy), and finally will be healthy. Kang medicine (joy) and mother (wu) forget (wilderness), is the only good person䢍."

Han silk calligraphy is " test ", "Mawangdui silk book. Old book before the first volume of Lao Zi. "Tao Yuan" line 170: "The road is high and unobservable, and it is too deep (measure)."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The inscription from the " ding " to the " sword " means using a knife to engrave characters on the ding as a rule. The original meaning is the law.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「鼎」從「刀」，表示用刀在鼎上刻畫文字，作為法則。本義是法則。《左傳．昭公六年》：「鄭人鑄刑書」，杜預注：「鑄刑書於鼎，以為國之常法」。「則」字至今保留這一原義，但也被假借為虛詞的「則」。《說文》：「則，等畫物也。从刀从貝。貝，古之物貨也。𠟻，古文則。𠞋，亦古文則。𠟭，籒文則从鼎。」

　　戰國竹簡「鼎」往往寫作「貝」，為小篆所本。今天「則」字中的「貝」其實是古文字「鼎」的訛寫。竹簡「鼎」形或簡為「目」形，下加二橫為簡化符號。

　　金文表示使遵守法則，師詢簋：「不(丕)顯文武，膺受天令(命)，亦則殷民。」意謂顯赫的周文王、武王，承受天命，使殷商遺民遵守周朝的法則。又用作連詞，中山王方壺：「辭禮敬則賢人至」。又表示鑄刻、記載，𠫑羌鐘：「明則之于銘」，意謂明晰地刻畫在銘文中。

　　戰國竹簡用作連詞，《郭店簡．五行》簡6：「[不]安則不藥(樂)，不藥(樂)則亡(無)惪(德)。」《郭店簡．五行》簡29：「和則樂，樂則又(有)惪(德)。」《郭店簡．尊德義》簡33：「不忠則不信」。《上博竹書一．緇衣》簡17：「則民慎於言而謹於行」。《上博竹書二．從政甲》簡7：「不敬則事亡(無)城(成)」。《上博竹書七．武王踐阼》簡14：「敬勝怠則吉」。《清華簡一．耆夜》簡11：「母(毋)巳(已)大藥(樂)，則終以康，康藥(樂)而母(毋)忘(荒)，是隹(惟)良士之䢍䢍。」

　　漢帛書通假為「測」，《馬王堆帛書．老子乙本卷前古佚書．道原》第170行：「上道高而不可察也，深而不可則(測)也。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「鼎」從「刀」，表示用刀在鼎上刻畫文字，作為法則。本義是法則。

(Simplified: 则)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: Laws inscribed 刂 on a slate 貝
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
    • 刂 [ dāo ] knife
①模範：以身作則。
②規程，制度：規則。總則。原則。細則。
③效法：則先烈之言行。
④表示因果關係，就，便：聞過則喜。
⑤表示轉折，卻：今則不然。
⑥表示肯定判斷，乃，是：此則餘之罪也。
⑦用在一、二、三……等數字後，列舉原因或理由：一則房子太小，二則參加的人數多。
⑧與“做”相近(中國宋、元、明代小說、戲劇裏常用)：則甚(做什麼)。
⑨量詞，指成文的條數：新聞兩則。
(Simplified: 则)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: Laws inscribed 刂 on a slate 貝

Think of digging for clams in an area where there are gaming rules governing how large a find has to be before you can keep it. So you take your trusty saber, which you have carefully notched like a yardstick, crack open a clam and then measure the poor little beastie to see if it is as long as the rules say it has to be.

原則(げんそく): principle, general rule
不規則(ふきそく): irregularity, unsteadiness, disorderly
法則(ほうそく): law, rule
規則(きそく): regulations

金文從「 鼎 」從「 刀 」，表示用刀在鼎上刻畫文字，作為法則。本義是法則。《左傳．昭公六年》：「鄭人鑄刑書」，杜預注：「鑄刑書於鼎，以為國之常法」。「 則 」字至今保留這一原義，但也被假借為虛詞的「 則 」。《說文》：「則，等畫物也。从刀从貝。貝，古之物貨也。𠟻，古文則。𠞋，亦古文則。𠟭，籒文則从鼎。」 戰國竹簡「 鼎 」往往寫作「 貝 」，為小篆所本。今天「 則 」字中的「 貝 」其實是古文字「 鼎 」的訛寫。竹簡「 鼎 」形或簡為「 目 」形，下加二橫為簡化符號。 金文表示使遵守法則，師詢簋：「不(丕)顯文武，膺受天令(命)，亦則殷民。」意謂顯赫的周文王、武王，承受天命，使殷商遺民遵守周朝的法則。又用作連詞，中山王方壺：「辭禮敬則賢人至」。又表示鑄刻、記載，𠫑羌鐘：「明則之于銘」，意謂明晰地刻畫在銘文中。 戰國竹簡用作連詞，《郭店簡．五行》簡6：「[不]安則不藥(樂)，不藥(樂)則亡(無)惪(德)。」《郭店簡．五行》簡29：「和則樂，樂則又(有)惪(德)。」《郭店簡．尊德義》簡33：「不忠則不信」。《上博竹書一．緇衣》簡17：「則民慎於言而謹於行」。《上博竹書二．從政甲》簡7：「不敬則事亡(無)城(成)」。《上博竹書七．武王踐阼》簡14：「敬勝怠則吉」。《清華簡一．耆夜》簡11：「母(毋)巳(已)大藥(樂)，則終以康，康藥(樂)而母(毋)忘(荒)，是隹(惟)良士之䢍䢍。」 漢帛書通假為「 測 」，《馬王堆帛書．老子乙本卷前古佚書．道原》第170行：「上道高而不可察也，深而不可則(測)也。」

The Sixth Year of Zhaogong": "Zheng people cast a penalty book", Du's note: "To cast a penalty book in a tripod is the common law of the country." " It is" still retains the original meaning of the word, but also as a function words under the guise of " the." "Said Wen": "Then, wait for the paintings. From the knife to the shell. Shell, the ancient objects and goods. 𠟻, the ancient text. 𠞋, also the ancient text. 𠟭, the 籒wen from the tripod." The " ding" on the bamboo slips of the Warring States period is often written as " bei", which is the origin of the small seal. The " bei" in the word " ze" today is actually an error of the ancient word " ding". The bamboo slips " ding" shape or simply " 目" shape, add two horizontal lines below to simplify symbols. Jin Wen said to obey the law, the teacher inquired: "If you don't show civil and martial arts, if you receive the order of heaven (order), you will also get the people." It means that the prominent Zhou Wenwang and Wu Wang will accept the destiny and make the Yin Shang survivors obey The law of the Zhou Dynasty. Also used as a conjunction, Zhongshan Wang Fanghu: "Respect and respect, then the wise will come." It also means to engrave and record, 𠫑Qiang bell: "Ming is in the inscription", which means that it is clearly engraved in the inscription. 則字的基本解释

則
zé
见“则”。

則字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zé］
［《廣韻》子德切，入德，精。］
“1”的今字。“则1”的繁体字。
(1)划分等级。
(2)引申为等级。
(3)古指三百平方里以下的采邑。
(4)相同，均等。
(5)标准权衡器。
(6)谓权衡，衡量。
(7)规律；法则。
(8)规章；法度。
(9)楷模；准则。
(10)仿效；效法。
(11)犹形迹。
(12)作，做。
(13)立即，马上。
(14)副词。犹乃，就是。加强肯定语气。
(15)副词。即，就。表示前后两事时间相距很近。
(16)副词。犹乃，才。
(17)副词。只，仅。
(18)连词。表承接。a.用于顺承，犹即，就。
(19)连词。表承接。b.用于逆承，犹言原来，早已。
(20)连词。表承接。c.所连接的后一部分是前一部分的结果，犹言就，那么。
(21)连词。表转折，犹却。
(22)连词。表平列。
(23)连词。表递进。犹而。
(24)连词。表假设。犹若，如果。
(25)连词。表因果。犹因此，所以。

則字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【刀字部】　則； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页139第31
〔古文〕????【唐韻】【正韻】子德切【集韻】【韻會】卽德切，?音側。【說文】則等畫物也。从刀貝。貝，古之物貨也。【徐曰】則，節也。取用有節，刀所以裁制之也。又【玉篇】法也。【爾雅·釋詁】則，常也。【疏】謂常禮法也。【周禮·天官·冢宰】以八則治都鄙。【鄭註】則，法也。又【增韻】凡制度品式皆曰則。【書·說命】明哲實作則。又天理不差曰則。【易·乾卦】乃見天則。【詩·大雅】順帝之則。又法其可法者曰則。【書·無逸】繼自今嗣王，則其無淫于觀，于逸，于遊，于田。【註】戒成王效法文王也。【詩·小雅】君子是則是傚。又【周禮】五命賜則註：地未成國之名。又夷則，七月律名。【前漢·律歷志】則，法也。言陽氣法度，而使隂氣夷當傷之物。又【韻會】助辭，又然後之辭。【論語】行有餘力，則以學文。

考證：〔【周禮·五命賜註】則，地未成國之名。〕　謹照原文註改則。則改註。

[①]［zé］
["Guangyun" Zi Deqie, Enter De, Jing. ]

(1) Divide levels.
(2) Extended to rank.
(3) Ancient refers to the benefice less than three hundred square miles.
(4) Same and equal.
(5) Standard weighing device.
(6) It is called weighing, weighing.
(7) Law; law.
(8) Regulations; laws.
(9) Models; guidelines.
(10) To imitate; to imitate.
(11) Still shape.
(12) Do, do.
(13) Immediately, immediately.
(14) Adverbs. Yunai, yes. Strengthen the affirmative tone.
(15) Adverbs. That is, just. It means that the two events are very close in time.
(16) Adverbs. Yunai, talent.
(17) Adverbs. Only, only.
(18) Conjunctions. Table to undertake. a. Used for Shuncheng, just as soon as possible.
(19) Conjunctions. Table to undertake. b. Used for adversity, it's still the original, long time ago.
(20) Conjunctions. Table to undertake. c. The latter part of the connection is the result of the previous part.
(21) Conjunctions. Table turning, but still.
(22) Conjunctions. Table parallel.
(23) Conjunctions. The table is progressive. Still.
(24) Conjunctions. Table hypothesis. As if, if.
(25) Conjunctions. Table cause and effect. So, so.

Name meaning

zé
вм. 则
Radicals: 貝, 刂  (shellfish, knife)
Meaning Mnemonic
A shellfish with a knife makes all the rules. It isn't supposed to be making rules, but it has a knife, so who's going to argue?
Picture a shellfish wielding a knife and shouting out new rules to all of the nervous people standing around it.
Reading Mnemonic
The first rule the shellfish enacts is that all humans take off their socks (そく) and give them to him. Hmm... is this some kind of nasty shellfish? Who would want socks?
Once everyone follows the rule, and the shellfish is on top of a pile of socks, he cackles, "It's easier to stab your toes with my knife now! Let's get to more rules!"
